bulkModification.info.addProcessSteps: You can add multiple process steps.

bulkModification.tip.forMorePowerfulModi: For more powerful and flexible modification capabilities,
bulkModification.tip.variables: You can define and preprocess variables here, then use it in process steps.
bulkModification.tip.processes: You can define process steps here, and use variables in steps, to modify all filtered resources.
bulkModification.tip.changes: Before applying bulk modification, you must calculate and check the changes here.
bulkModificationGuide.welcome.title: Welcome to Bulk Modification
bulkModificationGuide.welcome.descriptio: Bulk modification helps you quickly and efficiently modify properties of multiple resources. You can filter resources using any criteria and then batch update their property values.
bulkModificationGuide.welcome.highlight: All bulk modification configurations are automatically saved and can be reused anytime without reconfiguration.
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.title: Workflow
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.subtitle: Bulk modification consists of four steps, each with a clear purpose.
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.step1Desc: Use powerful filters to select resources to modify.
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.step2Desc: Predefine variables for reuse in process steps.
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.step3Desc: Set up operations on properties, supporting multi-step pipelines.
bulkModificationGuide.workflow.step4Desc: Calculate and review all changes, then apply when ready.
bulkModificationGuide.valueSources.title: Value Sources
bulkModificationGuide.valueSources.subti: You can get values from multiple sources.
bulkModificationGuide.valueSources.fixed: Directly input a fixed value to apply to all resources.
bulkModificationGuide.valueSources.varia: Reference values from other properties, including values from different scopes.
bulkModificationGuide.valueSources.delet: Clear the property value, setting it to empty.
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.title: Pipeline Processing
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.subtitle: Support multi-step chain processing where each step can use the result of the previous step.
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.explanati: Processes execute in order: Step 2 can use the new value from Step 1, Step 3 can use the result from Step 2, and so on. This makes complex bulk modifications simple.
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.example1: Step 1: Set Property A to value X
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.example2: Step 2: Based on Property A's new value X, set Property B to Y
bulkModificationGuide.pipeline.example3: Step 3: Continue processing based on previous results...
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.title: Save & Reuse
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.subtitle: Your bulk modification configurations are automatically saved for future reuse.
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.point1: Each bulk modification configuration is automatically saved to the list.
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.point2: You can duplicate existing configurations to quickly create similar new ones.
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.point3: Enable/disable status allows you to temporarily deactivate configurations.
bulkModificationGuide.saveReuse.tip: Tip: Give your bulk modification configurations meaningful names for easy lookup and reuse.

bulkModification.validation.invalidValue: Please provide a valid value type
bulkModification.validation.invalidPrope: Please provide a valid property type
bulkModification.label.scopeDescription: A property may have multiple dimensional values, and you can choose one of the dimensions as the base data.
bulkModification.label.followPropertyCha: By enabling this option, data will be changed according to the changes in dynamic properties (single choice, multiple choice, multilevel data, etc.).

For example, if you use the 'actor' from the multiple-choice data as the change result, then in the future, if you modify 'actor' to 'actor1', the current data will also be changed to 'actor1' after next time processing. However, if this option is not enabled, the current data will be changed to 'actor' after next time processing.
For properties (such as text, numbers, dates, etc.) without reference values, there is no difference between statuses of this option.
